channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023110964
item.description:
Report X-2023110964

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT OUT AND INNER PACKAGING ALLOWING MOVEMENT. THIS ALLOWED TOP OF BOTTLE TO BECOME CRUSHED AND CRACKED ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. NO DIAMOND ON OUTER CARTON. LTD. QTY. DIAMOND WAS ON INNER BOX AND WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110495
item.description:
Report E-2023110495

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: UPPER SANDUSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3066 Sika Floor 161-264 Part B release from a 1-gallon metal can. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of material released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail was containerized into a double lined 55-gallon metal drum. Soda ash and absorbents were then deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallet pieces were then containerized into a second double lined 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110383
item.description:
Report E-2023110383

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered leaking on the skid. The drum was immediately turned on to it's side and into an overpack container to prevent further release. The released material was collected using absorbent material and placed into an overpack for proper disposal. Investigation revealed that the drum was punctured by a protruding nail from the skid it was placed on. Due to the hazard of material, the package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over from unload to damage aea. The hazmat was put into a hazmat tub and then brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The box didn't look like it was crushed. But, the two bottles looked like they were crushed. They also leaked from the lid/top of container being dented inwards. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put it into the hazmat tote and in the hazmat cage. Turned on the exhaust fan on, to keep the vapors to a minimum if there are any.

item.title: Report E-2023110331
item.description:
Report E-2023110331

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 pint of STEAMATE PWR1440 (UN2491) was released from a 275-gallon metal tote due to a forklift accident. The forklift hit the valve at the bottom loosening the valve. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 12. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. The terminal placed oil dri on the impacted area, 3x3 and swept it into a (1)30Gal poly drum that was left as waste for the terminal to manage. After securing the valve, the tote picked up by a forklift and shook. There was no product discharge. Everything seems to be secured and the tote may be shipped on.
